content: What is the minimum number of shell commands required to alphabetically sort the list [apple, banana, orange, cherry]? Write a code that will output the correct sorted list using the minimum number of commands. Also, for an additional challenge, can you write the code using only the command line interface without using any text editors?

To alphabetically sort the list `[apple, banana, orange, cherry]` using shell commands, you can use the `echo` command to output the list and pipe it into the `sort` command. This can be done in a single command line statement.

Here is the code to do this:

```bash
echo -e "apple\nbanana\norange\ncherry" | sort
```

When you run this command in the terminal, it will output the sorted list:

```
apple
banana
cherry
orange
```

For the additional challenge of using only the command line interface without using any text editors, the above command already fulfills that requirement. You directly use `echo` to create the list and `sort` to arrange it alphabetically, all in one line.
